data.message: I think it's better if we don't need to send a friend request to them after we unblocked them.... 😒

replies.message: Thanks for your feedback Krystyn! We're constantly working to make our products better. We'll take this back to our team, and if you have any more suggestions, let us know here: http://on.fb.me/1bc3BDo -Hailey
Yes, because then they're like... Wait, weren't we friends???
Yep, because I blocked my relatives and I can't add them again because they will be suspicious..
Shouldnt have blocked your relatives then
Ahaha.. They're all over my wall and always checking everything.. If only you know the reason why.. Well s/he's the only one I blocked

That wouldn't be fair. If you can unblock them anytime you please and still be friends you can view their details while they are AFK and then block them again before they get back to a computer. There has to be a disconnect first before the restraining order. You don't hug people you have a restraining order against so don't block someone you want to stay friends with. Use the stop notifications and acquaintance status options on them next time.

And maybe someday @Facebook will employ some form of "game theory" like Cityville so people can see visually who can accessthe posts at each privacy setting and then rearrange their friends' avatars accordingly, visually, more lifelike-ably.
Seems like when you block them you are basically unfriending them. Why bother blocking?  I think you should be able to block and not unfriend. It only causes more issues with them!!
It's just Facebook. If you have something to hide don't put it on here.
